H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4938.def: = stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► used for walking or as attribute of a ruler, shepherd, or prophet; gives support to the sick and elderly; ≈ associated with authority and support

H5288.def: = a young male, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people; ≈ typically regarded as healthy and physically strong, but also lacking the experience and wisdom of the {L:older men<SDBH:זָקֵן>}

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H7182.def: = action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H7122.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6974.def: = process by which humans open their eyes after sleep; ≈ also used in the figurative sense of becoming active after a period of inactivity, and of being restored to life after having died

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H5288.def: = a young male, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people; ≈ typically regarded as healthy and physically strong, but also lacking the experience and wisdom of the {L:older men<SDBH:זָקֵן>}

H7901.def: = state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H4296.def: = a low platform standing on four legs, a bit longer than the length of a man, and about 70-80 centimeters wide; ► used by people of means to sit or sleep on

H5462.def: = causative action by which humans or deities close the entrance to a space with the help of a {L:door<SDBH:דֶּלֶת>}

H1817.def: = a hinged barrier at the entrance to a town, building, or room; ◄ usually made out of wood, but occasionally also out of metal; ► provides or prevents access; ≈ sometimes associated with vulnerability

H1157.def: = path through which a certain entity can be accessed, which can vary from a relatively narrow opening on one side to the entire surrounding space

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H6419.def: = state in which humans regard an event as likely to happen

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H7901.def: = state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

H3206.def: = posterity of humans and or animals of undetermined sex, at an age ranging from before birth to adulthood

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H1457.def: = action by which a human being adopts a position where the knees are bent and the upper body is brought forward and down

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H2552.def: = process by which human or inanimate objects feel or become warm or hot

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H1457.def: = action by which a human being adopts a position where the knees are bent and the upper body is brought forward and down

H5288.def: = a young male, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people; ≈ typically regarded as healthy and physically strong, but also lacking the experience and wisdom of the {L:older men<SDBH:זָקֵן>}

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H2237.def: = causative action by which someone applies pressure to a wound to remove pus and other liquids

H7651.def: = state in which a countable entity is seven in number

H6471.def: = the lower part of the leg beyond the ankle, on which humans or animals stand and with which they walk

H6491.def: literally: to open (someone else's) eyes; hence: = causative action by which deities give humans the ability to see things that they were not able to see before

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7812.def: = to lay oneself down on the ground ► as a sign of submission

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H1537.def: = ring or round disk with a rod (axle) running through its center or hub; either made of a solid piece of wood or a central hub connected with several spokes to an outer rim; ◄ made of wood and sometimes partly of iron; ► used to help vehicles move over the ground

H7458.def: = state of having a lack of food for a period of time, affecting an individual for a short time or a large number of people in a geographical area for a prolonged time (as in famine)

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H5030.def: = male person speaking on behalf of a deity

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H5288.def: = a young male, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people; ≈ typically regarded as healthy and physically strong, but also lacking the experience and wisdom of the {L:older men<SDBH:זָקֵן>}

H1310.def: = process by which food is getting ready for consumption by being immersed in boiling water for a prolonged period

H5138.def: = a meal made by boiling vegetables or legumes in water

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H3950.def: = causative action by which humans or animals bring together and take in objects from scattered places or sources

H219.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H1612.def: = a creeping plant, which grows along the ground until it finds a tree or other object to climb, using tendrils

H4393.def: = a certain quantity that fill a certain container

H6498.def: = a fruit that looks like a melon, cucumber, or calabash vine; it has a thick, watery root, which can penetrate deep into the ground; its stems creep on the ground, clinging to bushes or fences with their tendrils; its leaves are triangular and lobed like melon leaves; its yellow flowers develop into round yellow fruits the size of a large apple or grapefruit; the shell of the fruit is hard and smooth, and inside is a spongy pulp with white or brown seeds; ◄ Citrullus colocynthis; ► slightly poisonous, but used for stomach disorders and as a purgative

H899.def: = piece of cloth used to cover an object

H6398.def: = causative action by which humans use a sharp implement to split an object, either partially or completely

H5138.def: = a meal made by boiling vegetables or legumes in water

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3332.def: = process by which liquids flow from one place to another

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3201.def: mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7058.def: = flour made from ground grain kernels, ► used for baking bread, as ingredient for food, and as grain offering

H1190.def: = town; ◄ probably located in the region of {L:Shalishah<SDBH:שָׁלִשָׁה>}; territory of {L:Ephraim<SDBH:אֶפְרַיִם>}

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6861.def: meaning unsure: = sack or bag ► for carrying food

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H8184.def: = a type of cultivated grass like wheat or rice; less than 1 m tall; it produces a single head on each stalk, with rows of kernels; ◄ Hordeum distichum or Hordeum vulgare; ► its grain was used to make bread or beer, or for animal feed

H1061.def: = the earliest agricultural outcomes of the season; ► with an important function in the religious offerings system; ≈ often with a religious connotation

H3759.def: = newly ripened grain which has just been harvested and which has not yet been dried for storage or for grinding into flour
